channel.title: Hovering a Div
channel.description:
Solike, most of you have seen my newest website rifkwtf.com and probably noticed that it is hard to preview the images if the preview box is not visible!
Well, I want to fix that and can't really think of a way to get it to scroll with the browser. Anyone have any ideas?

item.title: Hovering a Div
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

sh!ft:

Look into frames, that would be the proper implementation and most browsers support frames. Or, an inner frame works well too, probably better in this case.

Lol’d

Mm CSS isn't implemented the same in every browser... Despite it's wide spread use, it's actually a no-no... Shitty browsers like IE don't support it fully, for example, a horizontal rule can have full css attributes in firefox, but in IE, it only has partial, and ends up looking miserable.
My website presents a warning if you use IE only because I believe that if you use IE, you fail.

And Bang, no, it’s not.
I want the box to the left of the images to hover vertically and stay to the left.

Read full topic

item.title: Hovering a Div
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

pwnd

is this more what you want?
http://host.sonspring.com/hoverbox/

if it is: heres a link for download http://sonspring.com/files/hoverbox.zip

Read full topic

item.title: Hovering a Div
item.dc:creator: @sh_ft sh!ft
item.description:
@sh_ft wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:1, topic:165673”]Solike, most of you have seen my newest website rifkwtf.com and probably noticed that it is hard to preview the images if the preview box is not visible!

Well, I want to fix that and can’t really think of a way to get it to scroll with the browser.
Anyone have any ideas?[/quote]
Look into frames, that would be the proper implementation and most browsers support frames. Or, an inner frame works well too, probably better in this case.

Mm CSS isn’t implemented the same in every browser… Despite it’s wide spread use, it’s actually a no-no… Shitty browsers like IE don’t support it fully, for example, a horizontal rule can have full css attributes in firefox, but in IE, it only has partial, and ends up looking miserable.

Read full topic

item.title: Hovering a Div
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“Exception, post:6, topic:165673”]I took a look at your picture page. If I’m understanding you correctly, I think a
position: absolute;
bottom: 20px;
MIGHT work. I had a footer stick to the bottom of the page even if the content was longer than the page by doing that. If not, JavaScript could be the way to go.[/quote]

DIRTY! I hate the bottom thing in css, it never works for me lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Hovering a Div
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

JavaScript was what I was looking at ;D
And if that works, thanks :]
I’ll have to give it a try after class.

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Hovering a Div
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

I took a look at your picture page. If I’m understanding you correctly, I think a
position: absolute;
bottom: 20px;
MIGHT work. I had a footer stick to the bottom of the page even if the content was longer than the page by doing that. If not, JavaScript could be the way to go.

Read full topic

item.title: Hovering a Div
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Im not sure if you can see the position of an inline element, but you’d better just put the links in positioned divs as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Hovering a Div
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“S!ms, post:3, topic:165673”]You want a preview when you hover the link? just create an image at pos x,y+12px with position:absolute.[/quote]Is there a way to see which portion of the page a user is looking at?

[quote=“kloplop321, post:2, topic:165673”]well you could use relative css positioning without placing it inside of another element.[/quote]I’ll place you inside another element.

Read full topic

item.title: Hovering a Div
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

You want a preview when you hover the link? just create an image at pos x,y+12px with position:absolute.

Read full topic
